intro: Conophytum hyracis, commonly known as the hyrax conophytum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the cooler months. It is typically found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, where it forms dense clusters. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
